figure_1.title: Figure 1.
figure_1.caption: Residual process for the parametric model π1(Z, β) based on the IeDEA HIV data along with the 95% goodness-of-fit band (grey area) and the corresponding p-value.

figure_2.title: Figure 2.
figure_2.caption: Transition probability estimates in the HIV study based on the naïve approach, the complete case analysis (CC) and the proposed NPM-PLE method.

claims.sentence: The left panel of Figure 1 clearly indicates the lack of fit of this model.
The residual process for this model (right panel of Figure 1) was close to 0 at all time points and remained within the 95% goodness-of-fit band (p-value=0.436).

Open in a new tab
Residual process for the parametric model π1(Z, β) based on the IeDEA HIV data along with the 95% goodness-of-fit band (grey area) and the corresponding p-value.The estimates of the transition probabilities of death while in HIV care and disengagement from care are presented in Figure 2.

The naïve analysis, which ignores the information from double-sampling, significantly underestimated mortality while in HIV care (left panel of Figure 2) and, also, overestimated disengagement from HIV care (right panel of Figure 2), compared to the proposed NPMPLE method.
The left panel of Figure 1 clearly indicates the lack of fit of this model.
The residual process for this model (right panel of Figure 1) was close to 0 at all time points and remained within the 95% goodness-of-fit band (p-value=0.436).
The estimates of the transition probabilities of death while in HIV care and disengagement from care are presented in Figure 2.

The naïve analysis, which ignores the information from double-sampling, significantly underestimated mortality while in HIV care (left panel of Figure 2) and, also, overestimated disengagement from HIV care (right panel of Figure 2), compared to the proposed NPMPLE method.
